Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century. Centered on Miyazawa’s own life, this film depicts his adolescence in the country, which he spent intensively reading books, and his young adulthood in Chicago, which he spent as a silent Japanese laborer.

Okay, since that's all you need to know, I won't go on and on and on about it. It's titled "The Pita and The Pizza," and it stars a clay humanoid named Carlos, who is diametrically opposed to another character called Col. Urine, who poops pizza.

A woman who hates cats (Alice Krige) and her son (Brian Krause) have moved into a small town, and must deal with a mean cat. The townspeople form a posse to destroy the cat, and things seem to be going well. Well, until they find that one cat has been turned into an army of other cats with special powers.
